website_summaries.verdict: A durable and affordable alternative to traditional armpit crutches, but should be viewed as very light-duty crutches. Owning a set of durable crutches is always a good idea for unexpected injuries or surgical recovery.
pros: Very affordable alternative to renting standard crutches
Sturdier and more durable than wooden crutches
cons: Not suitable for users over 250 lb
Original padding for armpits and hands is uncomfortable
Users in the recommended height range still had comfort issues

customer_reviews.title: No- unless emergency maybe
customer_reviews.text: Screws were bents when lowering handles so very difficult to get in and out. They were scratched up when received. Also were not delivered to my door. They don’t seem worth the price. If I were to resale I don’t think even brand new I would get more then $10 for them. The height doesn’t go to 5”10 on adults more like 5”7. Also if your weight is over 150 I would not think they would last long at all and may bend. If really need and on the light, short side and don’t care about perfection then these will work. Use rubber hammer to put back in the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to measure to your height. You will need to purchase extra cushion for hand grips and under arms. I would recommend you buy at the time of purchasing the crutches. Also if you do not know how to use crutches , YouTube has some awesome videos to show you how.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Through no fault of the crutches, I could not use them. Got them for foot surgery, but my back is not strong and I am very un balanced. They were a good choice going into my thoughts before my operation. JD
customer_reviews.author: Jaye Drukas

customer_reviews.title: Quality built.
customer_reviews.text: My hospital provided crutches lasted 4 weeks. These are by far a better product, feels stiffer and the rubber feet grip the ground amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: ryanoxj111

customer_reviews.title: They held up good, replace the armpit pads ASAP!
customer_reviews.text: Had to pick these up after a foot injury. I had to keep weight off of it for 120 days after surgery. These held up, only had to replace the tip, grips, and armpit pads once. I should have replaced the armpit pads when I first got these, the originals felt like 36 grit sandpaper.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these prior to my surgery, as I wanted time to practice with them beforehand. Easy to set up for my height (I am 5'2") with very clear instructions. Really great quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, price, and service.
customer_reviews.text: I'd get there underarm pads. The rubber can be uncomfortable after a bit. For the price they were all and more than I expected. No one can borrow them. They are mine. Can't rent cheaper. Same quality and no one's germs.
customer_reviews.author: CCMChristine

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to adjust, and the grip is good. Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Lamski

customer_reviews.title: If in a situation where one needs crutches, buy these!
customer_reviews.text: This product served a family member's needs quite well while recuperating from foot surgery. Light weight, easy to adjust and no need to purchase under arm pads. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: siberianmo

customer_reviews.title: Adults?
customer_reviews.text: If you are any taller than 5’10’’ these are not for you. I am 5’11’ and barely make them work.
customer_reviews.author: jaime fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid crutches
customer_reviews.text: I was on crutches for a few weeks after MPFL reconstruction surgery. These felt solid. I'm 5'9" and about 220 lbs, and worked well for me. I did use them with the Crutcheze pads, which helped with comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Size was perfect, worked well
customer_reviews.text: Used these for our child. She is right in the size range listed, and they fit perfectly. Sturdy, as comfortable as crutches can be, and no issues with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love em. Easy on under arms
customer_reviews.text: Love em. Easy on under arms. Easily adjustable height. Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.author: Senior Frog

customer_reviews.title: ... crutches when i found the support under the arms painful and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: i ordered the forearm crutches when i found the support under the arms painful and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ray santos

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy and very lightweight, and not like those wood ones.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: 10 weeks in use and still working great! I'm sure they will help us finish this tough time holding strong!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These crutches have really held up great. My daughter has been on them for quite awhile (over 2 1/2 months). They still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Happy the size was comparable
customer_reviews.text: This did it's job but make sure to wrap a hand towel around the foam because it hurts after a while. Happy the size was comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I know you get what you pay for, but I was thinking these crutches were like the standard aluminum crutches I was replacing. Wrong! First, when I unwrapped the package the smell of the CHEAP rubber on the underarm part about knocked me over. Its a strong chemical smell and mothballs combined! The underarm and hand grip covers are just that, COVERS. There is no padding whatsoever. Now I know the true definition of cheap crutches. These! Would return them but would cost more to package and send them than they are worth. I can't get them in the garbage soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches
customer_reviews.text: Been 1 month and working fine...i like it!! I would recommend these. Its cheap n serves good. if u need it buy it
customer_reviews.author: ninad d

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches for the price
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are excellent and served me well. The price was so low that I was worried until they arrived and I tried them. They adjusted perfectly and kept me going after foot surgery.
customer_reviews.author: P. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Crutch Product
customer_reviews.text: From Amazon Quick Purchase and helped from a knee condition. Did the job of moving around. Need to learn how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Jay

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after ankle surgery. The foam grips and pads were terrible and fell apart. I have only had the product for two weeks and the metal as already gone through the bottom grip. I am by no means near the maximum weight. I work in an office and sit most of the time. All in all I would not recommend that you buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Max length still a bit too short for this 5'7" gal :(
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'7" and even set on the maximum length (as noted on the crutches, for someone 5'10"), these crutches are a bit too short for me, (about 1 inch, according to my PT.) The quality is fine and I'm using them for short periods during the day, but the lack of height means I have to be careful to keep them close to my body when moving about...my PT says that I'd have a tad more stability if they were about an inch longer. If these weren't for short term use, I'd be shopping again for crutches that can better accomodate my height.
customer_reviews.author: hawkeyeinks

customer_reviews.title: plastic arm pit supports didn't last a month
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I sit at a desk all day and do not consider that I abused them in any way. Within a month both plastic arm pit supports broke. No matter how I tried to tape them, it was futile to try to repair them.
customer_reviews.author: kwhip

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy not enough for permanent crutches occupants
customer_reviews.text: I am permanent crutches occupant more than 28 years. I did not see any crutches like this. These crutches are too noisy and not enough for permanent crutches occupants. Crutches constantly squeaky every time I take a step.. I am not recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like these at all. They weren’t adjustable like the ad said. I am 5’5 and they were way to tall for me. I tried to adjust them, but I couldn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality crutches. Easy to adjust and paid a little more which shows in the quality
customer_reviews.author: raevarg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend these crutches. I have been using them for over 3 and half months and they do the job. The handles cause some pain in the hands/wrists due to the lack of padding but thats after really moving around on them. They have withstood getting sandy and wet at the lake/beach and have been thrown into the pool to be cleaned off and still work great.
customer_reviews.author: kevin Leguizamon

customer_reviews.title: good item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for short time use. I weigh 220 and felt very comfortable. Easy adjustable. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Llona Roach

customer_reviews.title: Fit right
customer_reviews.text: With additional pads these are great. A bit uncomfortable without the extra padding. I got the tall ones- I’m 5’11 and am using on the 5’11 mark on the crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Collie Mom

customer_reviews.title: They were OK...in the box
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't get to use them, about three weeks after breaking my right ankle i could walk without a limp. Short after, they came and I had no use for them.
customer_reviews.author: DoomsDayerPrep

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Feels way too flimsy to be weight rated so high, but I stopped using them when I got my knee scooter anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability
customer_reviews.text: Using this product after foot surgery. After a few weeks of steady use, one of the crutches is very creaky. Makes me think it isn't going to be much longer before it starts to come apart.
customer_reviews.author: kirddes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and price, love the easy of changing height
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Quality very good
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent purchase. The price was right for me. I would recommend these crutches to most everyone who needs temporary assistance for a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: What can you say? I wish I didn't need these. But they are lightweight and work. Crutcheze are a must, though, because the nasty grey padding they come with are useless.
customer_reviews.author: RPH in DC

customer_reviews.title: Quality was better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and worked as advertised. Quality was better than expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lardy McButterhead

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality/Construction
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty, I weigh 240 lbs. and they are extremely sturdy. Excellent value here.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: Used crutch with seperately purchased knee shelf.
customer_reviews.text: Solid crutch. Needed something with screw holes to attach knee shelf. Worked well. Used the crutch with shelf to get up a few stairs into the house after having foot surgery.
customer_reviews.author: J from MA

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Adjusted the handgrips and while using lost a wing nut so now minus one hand grip.
customer_reviews.author: t4l0r13

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good for what I needed. Sizing for under five foot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine crutches.
customer_reviews.text: I've been hobbling around on these things for four weeks now. I have no complaints. They're light, robust, and adjustable. I have been wondering if I should have gotten the European style forearm crutches instead. I used those as a kid and remember them being more comfortable - but maybe I was just lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Super Value
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded our expectations. My wife had a torn miniscus, and the crutches were needed. They are first rate and adjustable in height and for hand grips. You cannot go wrong with these! We are fully pleased with this purchase. Tom Chambersburg, PA
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Held up well, though interior of handles eroded and shed material some. Held up well to use by a big guy - 6'2", 275 lbs, stashed comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not buy these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after ankle surgery to replace the old pair my daughter played with. The rubber on the bottom wore off after just a few uses. I'm not impressed with these crutches and used my old pair because they were sturdier and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Kalykatkat

customer_reviews.title: very strong
customer_reviews.text: If you have to have crutches these are very good. Totally adjustable. I'm 5'10'' no problem. Had room for further adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Dibba

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Too short. They are advertised to fit someone 6'1" & taller. They would be fine for someone under 6'. Am really pleased with Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: light duty
customer_reviews.text: churches are pretty light duty although weight limit is ok, they are pretty flimsy so dont lean on them .
customer_reviews.author: jim ashcraft

customer_reviews.title: Not acceptable at all.
customer_reviews.text: The crutches did not deserve even one star. Upon opening the box, one crutch was unusable due to a defect involving a pop-rivet that was supposed to attach one of the arms holding up the arm-pit on one side. The company issued a credit which was also totally unacceptable because the crutches were needed - not a defective product and the refund was also not acceptable because the requested part could not be furnished and no attempt was made to provide another set of crutches which would have been acceptable and we would gladly return the defective set .
customer_reviews.author: Mike Todd

customer_reviews.title: May work for others but not me.
customer_reviews.text: I was not strong enough to uses crutches. Used a walker instead.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Kalish

customer_reviews.title: That might not be the best thing to buy
customer_reviews.text: Broke apart in a few Weeks I am a long time user And I know my crutches might not be the best thing to buy
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Just as described!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Adult size for my husband, who is 5'6". I'm just an inch taller, and these are the perfect height. The pads do feel a little bit cheaper than the ones we have rented at the medical supply store, but that is easily fixed by ordering different ones. For the price, these are an excellent pair of crutches to have at home "just in case".
customer_reviews.author: WDRM

product_meta.title: DMI Crutches, Push Button Adjustable Crutches, Aluminum Crutches with Pads, Tips, and Handgrips Accessories, Adult 5 Foot 2 to 5 Foot 10, Silver and Gray
product_meta.description:
Size:Adult

DMI CRUTCHES, PUSH BUTTON ADJUSTABLE CRUTCHES, ALUMINUM CRUTCHES

Mobility, Convenience, and Comfort at the Push of a Button

GREAT CRUTCHES FOR:

Foot, leg, and hip injuries Recovering from surgery
ALUMINUM CRUTCHES BENEFITS:

Convenient and easy-to-carry. Lightweight Adjusts easily with the push of a button for a custom fit
DMI ADJUSTABLE CRUTCHES FEATURES:

Includes comfortable crutch pads, handgrips and durable tips Made of durable lightweight aluminum Convenient push button adjustable height
DMI CRUTCHES SPECIFICATIONS:

Adjusts from 44 to 52 inches. Made for those who are 5’2” to 5’10” Size 8 by 1 by 52 inches Weight capacity is 250 pounds Weighs only 3.8 pounds Made of anodized aluminum
WARRANTY AND GUARANTEE:

Amazon Exclusive Limited warranty may apply. Please see product for additional details.
Click Add To Cart Today!
feature_bullets: CRUTCHES THAT INCLUDE EVERYTHING you need to get up and moving, includes: comfortable crutch pads, handgrips, and durable, slip-resistant tips
CONVENIENT PUSH BUTTON ADJUSTABLE CRUTCHES that effortlessly adjust to your height, adjusting from 44 to 52 inches. Generally made to fit adults height 5'2" to 5'10"
LIGHT WEIGHT EASY TO CARRY ALUMINUM CRUTCHES are also extremely durable, supporting up to 250 pounds
LONG LASTING GREAT CRUTCHES FOR recovering from injuries, surgeries, and more

WARRANTY AND GUARANTEE: Amazon Exclusive Limited warranty may apply. Please see product for additional details. NOTE: Note: we can only guarantee the quality of this product when sold through Amazon.com or Brazos Walking Sticks

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
